relations.target: lust=01191018-v (have a craving, appetite, or great desire for);00760688-n (self-indulgent sexual desire (personified as one of the deadly sins));07504854-n (a strong sexual desire

pure=00362205-a (in a state of sexual virginity; \""pure and vestal modesty\""; \""a spinster or virgin lady\""; \""men have decreed that their women must be pure and virginal\"");00394569-a ((of color) being chromatically pure; not diluted with white or grey or black);00866098-a (concerned with theory and data rather than practice; opposed to applied; \""pure science\"");01167404-a (free from discordant qualities);01911024-a ((used of persons or behaviors) having no faults; sinless; \""I felt pure and sweet as a new baby\""- Sylvia Plath; \""pure as the driven snow\"");01911832-a (free of extraneous elements of any kind; \""pure air and water\""; \""pure gold\""; \""pure primary colors\""; \""the violin's pure and lovely song\""; \""pure tones\""; \""pure oxygen\""

affection=07560035-n (a positive feeling of liking; \""he had trouble expressing the affection he felt\""; \""the child won everyone's heart\""; \""the warmness of his welcome made us feel right at home\""

romantic=10557379-n (a soulful or amorous idealist);10557463-n (an artist of the Romantic Movement or someone influenced by Romanticism);01468104-a (expressive of or exciting sexual love or romance; \""her amatory affairs\""; \""amorous glances\""; \""a romantic adventure\""; \""a romantic moonlight ride\"");01842899-a (not sensible about practical matters; idealistic and unrealistic; \""as quixotic as a restoration of medieval knighthood\""; \""a romantic disregard for money\""; \""a wild-eyed dream of a world state\"");02799975-a (belonging to or characteristic of Romanticism or the Romantic Movement in the arts; \""romantic poetry\""

senses.definition: The form of romantic affection that is considered pure and wholly positive, not just based on feelings of lust
